result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca M Butler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca M Butler appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Rebecca M Butler.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski.

Case in court for a calendar call.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Defendant has other pending matters currently set for trial.  Defense informs the court of Ms. Butler's medical issues.  Court ordered Ms. Butler to provide documentation to the court.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 2, 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, appeared in person.  James C Griffin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case set for a Status Conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a bench warrant STAYED until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca M Butler in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca M Butler in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD via Zoom. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rebecca M Butler in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran via zoom.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Defense counsel has informed the court Branch 37 will allow transfer for global resolution.  Branch 2 will accept the case from Branch 37 for a global resolution.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date .  The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2 in person/*  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 025934,
Payable Number: 992343,
Receipt Number: 22RP010398,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Rebecca M Butler in court by video with Attorney James Edgar Toran who appears in person.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Deputy A. Galewski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
 Defendant Rebecca M Butler in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Rebecca M Butler in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
